# F wire-break detection

You can set whether a wire-break check is to be performed for each individual channel (< 3.6 mA; otherwise, detected at 1.18 mA underflow). If wire break is detected, a diagnostics interrupt will be triggered in the CPU and a corresponding process control message will be sent on the OS.

Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)

Operating Manual, 04/2018, A5E43228905-AA

# Configuring S7F/FH hardware

# 6.4 Setting system parameters for F-signal modules

# F-short-circuit detection

If a short-circuit is detected, a diagnostics interrupt will be triggered in the CPU and a corresponding process control message will be sent on the OS. Advanced short-circuit diagnostics can be triggered when required by means of additional limit-value monitoring.
Q: What happens when a wire-break is detected in the F wire-break detection system?
A1: A diagnostics interrupt is triggered in the CPU and a corresponding process control message is sent on the OS.
A2: Upon detection of a wire-break (< 3.6 mA), the system triggers a CPU diagnostics interrupt and sends a process control message to the OS.
A3: The system responds to a wire-break detection by initiating a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and dispatching a process control message via the OS.
A4: For wire-break detection (< 3.6 mA), the system ensures a diagnostics interrupt is activated in the CPU alongside sending a relevant message to the OS.
A5: Detection of a wire-break results in two actions: triggering a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and sending a process control message on the OS.

Q: How is a short-circuit detected in the F-short-circuit detection system?
A1: A short-circuit detection triggers a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and sends a process control message on the OS.
A2: When a short-circuit is identified, the system initiates a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and communicates the event through a process control message on the OS.
A3: The system detects a short-circuit and responds by triggering a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and issuing a process control message on the OS.
A4: Short-circuit detection leads to a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and the transmission of a process control message via the OS.
A5: Upon detecting a short-circuit, the system executes a diagnostics interrupt in the CPU and notifies the OS with a process control message.
